an4.133:1: "Bhikkhus, there are these four kinds of persons found existing in the world. What four? One who understands quickly; one who understands through elaboration; one who needs to be guided; and one for whom the word is the maximum. These are the four kinds of persons found existing in the world."[n.83] Nett 25 (Be §88) correlates these four types with the four kinds of practice (seeAN4.6–62): theugghaṭitaññū puggalawith one emancipated by pleasant practice and quick direct knowledge, thevipañcitaññū puggalawith one emancipated by either painful practice and quick direct knowledge or by pleasant practice and sluggish direct knowledge, and theneyya puggalawith one emancipated by painful practice and sluggish direct knowledge. Thepadaparama puggalais not emancipated and thus the four alternatives do not apply.
